issue.title: For the value of the send and receive satoshi of the qt-wallet.

events.body: This issue tracker is used to track technical issues related to the Bitcoin Core code base.

@sipa 
Sorry to use the Sugar screenshot. I forgot to tell him to change to Bitcoin.

He is a designer who is developing Sugar with me. When I was developing GUI with him, I thought his idea was good.

He will upload his idea back to version with Bitcoin 0.18 (or 0.17). Then look at his ideas again.

@MarcoFalke 
Thank you for your good feedback. But can not we make a QT GUI design proposal here?
I have no idea what you're suggesting.

> But can not we make a QT GUI design proposal here?

Not as an issue. Please propose your changes as a pull request

The problem is that the starting value is not listed as '0.00000000'.
If it was written from the beginning, minor problems can disappear.
The place to write down the amount is `blank`. If we change it to `0.00000000`, we can understand it more intuitively. Let's listen to him again for details. @Ghrogy
The default value should indeed be blank (as it is now) and you are supposed to type (or copy-paste) the value you want to send
@MarcoFalke OK I understood. He will make a awesome PR with Photoshop :)
